item.description:
It would be SWEET to REPEAT a Meetup SWEEP again at Sweet Caroline's. We need you.

Join us the next time for a GREAT night of fresh fun fellowship.

Let's take over Sweet Caroline's again. There's plenty of room for us.

Check out this link for a recap of past games.

If this will be your first time meeting the Happy Hour Crew, check out the photos of those who RSVPd Yes so you can find the group.

 

If you need help coming up with a team name here are few suggestions:

Drinking Buddies

Thinking Buddies

Bent Elbow Crew

Smahties

Drinking With Strangers

$maht A$$e$

Titantic Swim Team

Know It Alls

Trivial Pursuers

Trivia Addicts

 

Sweet Caroline's is one of the newest spots in town with very tasty food, many selections of beer on draft and plenty of space for us to hang out.

Get there when you can and stay as long as you're able.

Another Happy Hour Good Time with the Best Drinking Buddies. Don't be shy...Say hi.

Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit. Ten minute walk from Kenmore station (green line) or Hynes Convention Center station (green line) or #1 Bus Mass Avenue bus stop at Boylston Street follow signs to Fenway Park.

Nearby metered street parking which operates until 8 PM is always available. Cost for the meter is .25c per 12 minutes. Bring enough quarters if you plan to stay until 8 PM

If you come hungry here's Sweet Caroline's Menu.

PLEASE MAINTAIN YOUR OWN TAB OR PAY AS YOU ORDER - THANK YOU

Put the insignificant information in your head to use in Sweet Caroline's pub quiz by Geeks Who Drink, which begins about 7 and ends around 9.

Geeks Who Drink Pub Quiz Rules:

1) To be eligible for prizes, teams are limited to six players.

2) The quiz consists of eight rounds of eight questions.

3) Questions are read aloud by the quizmaster and teams write down the answers, turning them in at the end of each round.

4) Rounds 1, 4 and 6 are themed rounds – anything from “Eight Questions About Sex That Won’t Make You Too Uncomfortable” to “TV Shows Your Parents Watch.”

5) Round 2 is a music round worth double points for which you name the artist and title for each song clip.

6) Round 3 is a multiple choice round or a speed round.

7) Round 5 is a visual round based on a printed handout.

8) The all-audio Round 7 usually covers movies or TV shows, and is worth the standard eight points.

9) Round 8 is always 16 points on Random Knowledge.

10) One round can be jokered, doubling your points for that round only (yes, the 16-point rounds are fair game).

11) The team with the most points after eight rounds is the winner.

12) No shouting out answers, and absolutely no using cellphones or other devices to look up answers! Teams breaking this rule are disqualified.

13) Have fun and good luck.
item.how_to_find_us: Seated at the booths up the stairs across from the bar. Check out each others profile photos, so you can find each other.
item.name: Geeks Who Drink Pub Quiz at Sweet Caroline's Tuesday April 10th
